intro: Iria cymosa, commonly known as the clustered iria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems, producing a striking visual display. Iria cymosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
